TopicTitle: FTL Drive MK I (MKII Pictures inside)

Articles.Content:
do mind Unix-based OS\'s are case-sensitive for file names and paths, while windows is definitely not so.... :

this leads to all assortments of frustration when producing cross-platform code... perhaps a failsafe device should be installed into the loader, so all paths are made case-insensitive to prevent further mistakes from this

so hmm, yeah... check your filenames :cheers:

do mind Unix-based OS\'s are case-sensitive for file names and paths, while windows is definitely not so.... :

this leads to all assortments of frustration when producing cross-platform code... perhaps a failsafe device should be installed into the loader, so all paths are made case-insensitive to prevent further mistakes from this

so hmm, yeah... check your filenames :cheers:

That is actually a great idea, a failsafe should make this problem almost non-existent. I don\'t use Mac OSX much at all (Windows has the most support for gaming) I don\'t want anyone to be excluded from playing this game.

i\'ve had this problem before... i\'d advise you double-check the case on the .dae file extension....

many times i\'ve seen .DAE extensions written in upper case - try using that and see if it loads :thumbup:

-snip- WARNING, WILL ACTIVATE EVEN IF DISCONNECTED FROM MAIN SHIP. -snip-

gratuitously giant and powerful missiles, here i come

gratuitously giant and powerful missiles, here i come

I saw in a CGF a code snippit thingy that said activateevenifdisconnected = true, something like that, but when i tried it on this nothing happened so i just took it out.

However if you know it is supported and i did it wrong, i would love to have it activate while not connected to the main ship.

I saw in a CGF a code snippit thingy that said activateevenifdisconnected = true, something like that, but when i tried it on this nothing happened so i just took it out.

However if you know it is supported and i did it wrong, i would love to have it activate while not connected to the main ship.

Strangely enough, that parameter isn\'t in the page on the wiki, despite having existed since KSP v 0.9-ish? Anyways, the actual parameter is:

ActivatesEvenIfDisconnected = True

Still hanging on loading on a mac. Error in the debug console is 'KeyNotFoundException: the given key was not present in the dictionary.' I can\'t tell which key it\'s talking about because the debug console won\'t stretch out to let me see the whole line.
